poem:
"Salvation in Wood Grain and Woven Yarn"

Our buttons are of wooden ilk,
our trousers sewn in organic wares,
yet, to each, a thread of guilt,
in the wider gown the planet wears.
Beyond our garb, the bigger feat,
Is political will we must entreat.
For save it may a tree or three,
True change lies within policy.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative.
